isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (NAVPAK) (1997) - SECTION 3.5: ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS, ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION SENSOR/IVS SWITCH (APS/IVS) - HYDRAULIC PRESSURE GOVERNOR - SIGNAL FUNCTIONS

svcproc.title: SIGNAL FUNCTIONS
svcproc.para: The Hydraulic Pressure Governor (HPG) is an optional feature used for closed loop control of hydraulic pressure based on an external hydraulic pressure input and a programmable desired hydraulic pressure. This feature is targeted for fluid delivery pumps, especially fire truck applications.

The HPG feature is active when no HPS (hydraulic pressure sensor) signal fault exists, the driveline is in its proper state (which is dependent on the type of pump used), the vehicle is stationary and its corresponding programmable parameter is turned on.

When the HPG feature is first initiated, the desired hydraulic pressure is ramped up at a programmable ramp rate. The limited desired pressure (set point) is then used along with the actual hydraulic pressure signal (feedback) to control desired engine speed required to achieve the desired hydraulic pressure.
